title: Project-Based Language Learning Design for Attitude Change Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and understanding of attitude change concepts
context.additional_context: Emphasis on Small-Group Activities Centered on Personal Device Utilization and Collaboration

learning_goals: Learners can explain the importance of an open attitude in language use and propose three or more strategies applicable to real-world contexts.
Learners can design and present practical examples of reducing cultural biases through PBL activities.
Learners develop a self-assessment tool to measure attitude changes based on peer feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
